Intro.Title: About this project
Intro.Description: This project details the implementation of a ground station based on software-defined radio (SDR) at the School of Electrical, Electronic and Telecommunications Engineering (E3T) of the Industrial University of Santander. The initiative arises from the lack of access to updated satellite data and images, attributed to the absence of a functional ground station. By reactivating this station, it is incorporated into the network of satNOGS ground stations, being the first active one in Bucaramanga.

Content.Description: The ground station is located at the School of Electrical, Electronic and Telecommunications Engineering (E3T) of the Industrial University of Santander, Bucaramanga.

The installation process involved: Evaluating the space in the high voltage lab, Mounting the Raspberry Pi 3 B+ and RTL-SDR in an IP65 sealed box, Connecting the ethernet cable, power supply, and adjusting parameters for optimal signal reception, Configuring the SatNOGS client and assigning observations through the SatNOGS website, Testing signal reception from NOAA 15 satellite.

The software used in the project includes: Raspbian operating system, SatNOGS client software, SoapySDR and CubicSDR for signal visualization, GNU Radio for signal processing, HTML, CSS, and JavaScript for the web platform.

A monopole antenna is used, provided by the high voltage laboratory. It is located on the roof of the building and is connected to the station with a coaxial cable. This antenna is suitable for capturing signals from satellites with trajectories far from the zenith.

A Raspberry Pi 3 B+ serves as the central processing unit of the ground station. It is equipped with processing and storage capabilities and runs the SatNOGS software to coordinate the operation of the station.

An industrial switching power supply is used to power the ground station. It has a 5V, 10A output and ensures a stable power supply for continuous operation of the Raspberry Pi, RTL-SDR, and other devices.
A sealed box with an IP65 rating is used to protect the components of the ground station from dust and water.
